WRITING.TEXT: No pun intended right?

Your not a coward and your not weak. You've had to deal with a toxic relationship with your parent. Parents should be there for their children, not to cut them down.
But please don't kill yourself. Even if your mom never believed in you, your friends did. Friendship is very powerful, and sometimes means more than blood relations. Why not try and prove her wrong? Why not become successful and achieve your dreams and show your mother that you are not worthless, but a valuable human being who doesn't need her hate and toxicity.

Hey, if you want someone to talk I'd be more than happy to. Feel free to PM me. I go and check Reddit multiple times a day to see if people have contacted me. I'd be cool with talking to you through other mediums as well (text, iMessage, etc).

Hobbies are meant to be activties you enjoy. If you don't enjoy art, I don't think there's any reason to keep doing it. Still, are you drawing for fun or because your hoping to make it a career? If your doing because you enjoy it, who cares what other people say, or how you compare to others. If your doing it as a career, well, I know it's a tough business! While I only know so much about the art business, I do know a family friend who actually published a book on traditional art/sketches. So it's definetly not a worse less form of art or outdated. I draw sketches myself, and I'd be happy to compare our works if you want (I'm not that great though).

I'm surprised how much this resonated with me, how much this reminded me of my life. I've had friends betray and use me, treating me worse than the third wheel. The part about not ever thinking I will experience love is something I use to think and believe. So many times I've just wanted a shoulder to lie my head on, someone to hug. I've yet to have these wishes of mine fulfilled. Ive felt the emptiness and hollowness. Maybe I'm living a fool' dream, but there are billions of people on this earth, so I hold out hope that maybe just one them might love and understand me.
The people who hurt you and used you are terrible people. I've had people, "friends" leave me out or try and take advantage of me. This of course just made me more lonely than ever. I personally found it helpful to leave these people, as they only drag you down. No one deserves to be used and betrayed like that.
Still, I don't think you should end your life. To die takes a certain amount of courage; choosing to live, even more so. There are people and communities out there that can and want to help you. Of course I'd be happy to talk to you as well, anytime.
Because talking to a robot is going to make anyone feel better. Total bs.

As s teenager who has gone through depression, loneliness, and suicidal thoughts, I can understand to some extent what your going through. Yes, living can feel unbearable, and suicide might seem like the only way out. I thought so too.
Thing is, it's not. My tenacity payed off and things got better. I'm still struggling of course, and my life is nowhere near perfect, but I've found meaning in this pain. It took work and commitment, but life became just a little more bearable. There are people out there who can and want to help you. And of course you can talk to me whenever you want. I would it mean a lot to me, having gone through what you have.

Maybe I can't help you, but others can, and want to. You can always call 1-800-273-8255, the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline for help. There are networks and communities out there that want to help you, like the one mentioned above and SuicideWatch here on Reddit. And of course, I would be happy to try to help you in any way that I can.

Look, I can understand what your going through. The feeling that no one cares for me is something I've felt all my life. In 1st grade I was the one kid who sat on the bench alone while everyone else played and had fun. Things have gotten a little better, sure, but I still don't feel anyone really cares about me. So please, don't go. I do understand, being there myself. Maybe we can talk, help each other out.
Let Hydra deal with this one.
If you keep improving each and every day, yesterday isn't the worst version of yourself (unless you just started improving yesterday).
I know why they didn't teach me that, I'm saying that because I was negatively effected by my lack of knowledge, I'm sure others are/will be as well.

Maybe you shouldn't abandon public education, till ya learn your grammar! Jokes aside, just because public education teaches that masterbation is healthy, does not mean we should throw the whole system under the bus. The mainstream view is that porn is healthy, and public education should not be blamed for this.
That said I personally wish my health teachers would have warned me about PMO addiction, and the side effects that come with it. Teachers should at least make students aware of possible side effects and what have you.
Username checks out?
I prefer the term, "in the process of becoming winners."

Benefits come being proactive, not passive. Abstaining from PMO gives you time and energy (and other things as well), so start improving the things you want to be better in. Want to look more attractive, be more social, or get better grades? You have to actually practice at those things, not wait for benefits to just fall into your lap.
If you are being proactive, and still not seeing benefits, then just give it more time. Changes are a lengthy process.
I admire your optimism.
Gets coma.

Not having a gf is not a sign of you being a loser or not. I've never had a gf but I wouldn't consider myself a "loser."

I relapsed too, your not alone. We just have to keep pushing foward.
Changes don't come from being passive. Not PMOing is not enough. You need to actively work on the things you want to improve.
Checks_out_bot, your username checks out.

Yup, PMO addiction works just like this. At first I was satisfied with just watching porn. Then I started to actual fap. But after a while the videos I used weren't enough, so I found new ones. But then "normal" videos weren't enough so I looked for videos that were violent/forced. If I didn't start NoFap, I would have started looking for even worse things for sure.

Okay, I think I better understand your position. And while I see that the animal part of our brain might override our rational part in suicide, I'm not convinced that this is the case always.
I say this because our prefrontal cortex does (can) control our limbic system [1]. Of course it takes effort, but it is possible. And while our animal part of our brain might always act for survival, I'm not convinced that the other parts of our brain work this way.
Still, I don't think this takes away from your message that we should work with our limbic system, not vilify it. But part of working with it means controlling it and not letting take over, if you will.
[1] https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/fulfillment-any-age/201210/turn-down-your-brain-s-worry-center
I though you were talking about a very different kind of weapon.....Giggity.

"your brain can't reasonably convince you to go against your own survival."
Could you clarify what you mean by "reasonably convince"? Because people can (and have) killed themselves.
Me and my dick

You do not fear relapse. You think this makes you strong, it makes you weak. How can you move faster than possible, fight longer than possible without the most powerful impulse of the spirit: the fear of relapse.
I remember missing workouts because I was too busy PMOing.
That's word, bird!
You missed the reference. Now I'm sad.
...it's about the amount you accomplish each day.
You use inches? Pfft, you guys are tiny! I use feet when I measure my dick. Mines at a whopping .001 ft long. Don't be to jealous.
You still haven't given up on me.

Accept you can overcome anxiety and depression. It takes time and effort, but it's definetly possible. Look, embracing the fact we experience pain and suffering is one thing. Making that your reality is just stupid and self destructive.
I use to think like you do, thinking that I should embrace my suffering and loneliness, make it my reality. Trust me, there's no happiness in such a path. In many ways, it's the easy way out: Why try and cure my anxiety and depression? Why not just give in and accept this is who I am? Instead of fixing the problem, you just give up.
To sum up, embracing pain is one thing, making it your reality is another. If you mean the latter, your advice is harmful and wrong. If you mean the former, you should change your language to clarify.
Agreed, there's good pain and bad pain.
You've mastered the art of syllogism.
Pretty good, considering I work as a janitor.
Well you can't expect benefits like that to just fall into your lap. You gotta go out and practice socializing if you want to get better.

Same thing for your emotional/mental six pack. You have to actual go out and socialize and what not if you really want that jaw-dropping emotional abs.
I'm with ya. Enough is enough. I'm going to make it, come hell or high water.
